required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hydrocortisone Replacement in Patients With Secondary Adrenal Insufficiency (SUPREME CORT)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Double Blind Cross-over Study of the Effects of Low Dose and High Dose Hydrocortisone Replacement Therapy on Cognition, Quality of Life, Metabolic Profile and Somatosensation in Patients With Secondary Adrenal Insufficiency

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate whether a physiologically low hydrocortisone (HC) dose is better for cognition as compared to a physiologically high HC dose. In addition, quality of life, metabolic profile and somatosensation will be described in relation to HC dose.

detailed_description.textblock:
- Rationale: A wide variety in hydrocortisone (HC) substitution dose-regimens are considered physiological for patients with adrenal insufficiency. However, it is likely that cognition is negatively influenced by higher cortisol exposure to the brain. No studies have been performed to assess the effects of treatment regimens with a low physiological HC substitution dose on cognition in comparison to a high physiological HC substitution dose. These treatment regimens should take body weight and multiple dosing into account. In addition, substitution doses should be monitored by clinical evaluation and biochemical analysis for adverse effects associated with over- or under-replacement.
- Intervention: Patients with secondary adrenal insufficiency will be randomized in two groups to receive either a low dose HC (0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight) for 10 weeks followed by 10 weeks of high dose HC (0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight) or vice versa. At baseline and after both treatment periods, patients will be tested.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognition After 10 Weeks of Treatment With a Low Dose of Hydrocortisone Compared to 10 Weeks of Treatment With a High Dose of Hydrocortisone.
primary_outcome.time_frame: After completion of treatment period 1 (that is after 10 weeks from baseline) and after treatment period 2 (that is after 20 weeks from baseline).
primary_outcome.description: Cognitive domains to be tested: memory, executive functioning, attention and social cognition. The psychological tests consist of oral and written questions or computer tasks. Data is given as Z-scores based on normative data. Higher Z-scores represent a better performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life After 10 Weeks of Treatment With a Low Dose of Hydrocortisone Compared to 10 Weeks of Treatment With a High Dose of Hydrocortisone.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After completion of treatment period 1 (that is after 10 weeks from baseline) and after treatment period 2 (that is after 20 weeks from baseline).
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life questionnaires have to be filled in by the participant at his/her home place and have to be returned by post.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Profile After 10 Weeks of Treatment With a Low Dose of Hydrocortisone Compared to 10 Weeks of Treatment With a High Dose of Hydrocortisone.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After completion of treatment period 1 (that is after 10 weeks from baseline) and after treatment period 2 (that is after 20 weeks from baseline).
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular and metabolic risk factors, (pituitary) hormones and bone markers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Somatosensation After 10 Weeks of Treatment With a Low Dose of Hydrocortisone Compared to 10 Weeks of Treatment With a High Dose of Hydrocortisone.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After completion of treatment period 1 (that is after 10 weeks from baseline) and after treatment period 2 (that is after 20 weeks from baseline).
secondary_outcome.description: Measures of somatosensation: the mechanical detection threshold, the mechanical pain threshold, mechanical pain sensitivity, dynamic mechanical allodynia, wind up ratio and the pressure pain threshold.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Perceived Common Somatic Complaints After 10 Weeks of Treatment With a Low Dose of Hydrocortisone Compared to 10 Weeks of Treatment With a High Dose of Hydrocortisone.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during treatment period 1 (that is from week 1 to week 10 from baseline) and during treatment period 2 (that is from week 11 to week 20 from baseline).
secondary_outcome.description: The patients report common somatic complaints by filling in structured daily diaries.

arm_group.arm_group_label: First low dose HC followed by high dose HC
arm_group.description: First low dose of hydrocortisone = 0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight for 10 weeks followed by a high dose of hydrocortisone = 0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight

arm_group.arm_group_label: First high dose HC followed by low dose HC
arm_group.description: First a high dose of hydrocortisone = 0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight for 10 weeks followed by a low dose of hydrocortisone = 0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight

intervention.description: Patients receive either a low dose HC (0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight) for 10 weeks followed by 10 weeks of high dose HC (0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight) or vice versa.
intervention.arm_group_label: First low dose HC followed by high dose HC
First high dose HC followed by low dose HC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with secondary adrenal insufficiency.
- Age ≥ 18 - 75 years
- ≥ One year after tumor treatment with surgery and/or radiotherapy
- On stable concomitant medications for at least six months prior to entry of study
- Body weight 50-100 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability of legal consent
- Documented cognitive impairment
- Drug abuse/dependence
- History of / current psychiatric disorders
- Use of anti-epileptics (e.g. carbamezapine)
- Cushing Disease
- Type 1 diabetes or Type 2 diabetes with medication known to induce hypoglycemia (f.e. Sulfonylurea derivatives
- Current treatment for second malignancy
- Have a significant medical condition (e.g. hepatic, respiratory, or cardiovascular) which, in the opinion of the investigator, may interfere with the interpretation of results and safety or efficacy evaluations.
- A history of frequent hypocortisolism
- Hospitalization during study
- Work in shifts

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Sixty-three patients were included in the study. Three patients withdrew from the study during the run-in phase, therefore a total of 60 patients started the first treatment period.

group.title: First a Low Dose of HC Followed by a High Dose of HC
group.description: First low dose of hydrocortisone = 0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight for 10 weeks followed by a high dose of hydrocortisone = 0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight

group.title: First a High Dose of HC Followed by a Low Dose of HC
group.description: First high dose of hydrocortisone = 0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight for 10 weeks followed by a low dose of hydrocortisone = 0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight

baseline.population: The 47 participants completing both study periods were used for further analysis.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All participants completing both study periods

measure.title: Type of surgery
measure.description: A total of 32 participants underwent surgery

measure.title: Type of radiotherapy
measure.description: A total of 19 participants received radiotherapy

measure.title: Total daily dose hydrocortisone treatment prior to randomization
Dose per kg body weight prior to randomization

outcome.title: Change in Cognition After 10 Weeks of Treatment With a Low Dose of Hydrocortisone Compared to 10 Weeks of Treatment With a High Dose of Hydrocortisone.
outcome.description: Cognitive domains to be tested: memory, executive functioning, attention and social cognition. The psychological tests consist of oral and written questions or computer tasks. Data is given as Z-scores based on normative data. Higher Z-scores represent a better performance.
outcome.time_frame: After completion of treatment period 1 (that is after 10 weeks from baseline) and after treatment period 2 (that is after 20 weeks from baseline).
outcome.population: The participants completing both study periods were analyzed

reported_events.time_frame: 4 weeks run in phase (if applicable) + 10 weeks (treatment period 1) + 10 weeks (treatment period 2)
reported_events.desc: On testdays patients were questioned to report any adverse events. Furthermore, in week 5 and week 15 of the treatment period, patients were asked if any adverse events happened. In between these assessments patients were able to report any adverse events when necessary.

group.title: Low Dose of HC
group.description: Administration of a low dose of hydrocortisone (0.2-0.3 mg/kg body weight) for 10 weeks

group.title: High Dose of HC
group.description: Administration of a high dose of hydrocortisone (0.4-0.6 mg/kg body weight) for 10 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
